qas.question: With what school did Bell get his next teaching job?
What did Bell do late at night?
What health condition did Bell start to have?
In what year did Bell start to focus on research into sound?

context: In the following year, Bell became professor of <a1_0>Vocal Physiology and Elocution<a1_0/> at the <a0_0>Boston University School of Oratory.<a0_0/> During this period, he alternated between Boston and Brantford, spending summers in his Canadian home. At Boston University, Bell was "swept up" by the excitement engendered by the many scientists and inventors residing in the city. He continued his research in sound and endeavored to find a way to transmit musical notes and articulate speech, but although absorbed by his <a2_0>experiments<a2_0/>, he found it difficult to devote enough time to experimentation. While days and evenings were occupied by his teaching and private classes, Bell began to stay awake late into the night, running experiment after experiment in rented facilities at his boarding house. Keeping "night owl" hours, he worried that his work would be discovered and took great pains to lock up his notebooks and laboratory equipment. Bell had a specially made table where he could place his notes and equipment inside a locking cover. Worse still, his health deteriorated as he suffered severe <a3_0>headaches<a3_0/>. Returning to Boston in fall <a4_0>1873<a4_0/>, Bell made a fateful decision to concentrate on his experiments in sound.
